proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: F on AD, B on ⊙(O, radius_O), ∠DOE, Arc(EOA), AD, ∠EOD, G on AF, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBF, ∠GBO, ∠OAD, ∠DOE, ∠DAO, F on BO, ∠COD, pi * (80 / 180) = Arc(AOC), AO, G on BC, 3.14 = pi, D on ⊙(O, radius_O), pi * (80 / 180) = Arc(DOB), ∠CBO, Arc(DOB), DO, ∠DOA, ∠BOC, ∠AOC, Arc(AOC), ∠AOE, ∠OAF, ∠ODA, ∠ADO, ∠EOD, H on EO, C on ⊙(O, radius_O), ∠DOB, ∠ODA, ∠CBO, A on ⊙(O, radius_O), ∠AOE, ∠FAO

Premises : F on AD, ∠DAO

Premises : ∠GBO, F on BO

Premises : D on ⊙(O, radius_O)
Conclusions: radius_O = DO

Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠CBO
Conclusions: ∠CBO = 2 * pi - ∠OBC

Step 10:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(DOB)
Conclusions: ∠DOB = Arc(DOB)

Step 11:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : DO, AD, AO
Conclusions: △ADO

Step 12:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠DOA, ∠AOC, ∠COD
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠AOC + ∠COD + ∠DOA

Step 13:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(AOC)
Conclusions: ∠AOC = Arc(AOC)

Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠AOE
Conclusions: ∠AOE = 2 * pi - ∠EOA

Step 15:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠OAF, G on AF
Conclusions: ∠OAF = ∠OAG

Step 16:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠ODA
Conclusions: ∠ODA = 2 * pi - ∠ADO

Step 17:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on AD, ∠ADO
Conclusions: ∠ADO = ∠FDO

Step 18:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠EOD
Conclusions: ∠EOD = 2 * pi - ∠DOE

Step 19:

Premises : ∠DOE, H on EO
Conclusions: ∠DOE = ∠DOH

Step 20:

Premises : C on ⊙(O, radius_O)
Conclusions: radius_O = CO

Step 21:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠DOB, ∠BOC, ∠COD
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠BOC + ∠COD + ∠DOB

Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠DOB, F on BO
Conclusions: ∠DOB = ∠DOF

Step 23:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠EOD, ∠DOB
Conclusions: pi = ∠DOB + ∠EOD

Step 24:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on AD, ∠ODA
Conclusions: ∠ODA = ∠ODF

Step 25:

Premises : G on BC, ∠CBO
Conclusions: ∠CBO = ∠GBO

Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : A on ⊙(O, radius_O)
Conclusions: radius_O = AO

Step 27:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠EOD, ∠AOE, ∠DOA
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠AOE + ∠DOA + ∠EOD

Step 28:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠FAO, G on AF
Conclusions: ∠FAO = ∠GAO

Step 29:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠GBF = ∠GBO, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBF
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBO

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_O = BO, radius_O = DO
Conclusions: BO = DO

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DOB = Arc(DOB), pi * (80 / 180) = Arc(DOB)
Conclusions: pi * (80 / 180) = ∠DOB

Step 32:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(A, D, O)
Premises : △ADO
Conclusions: pi = ∠ADO + ∠DOA + ∠OAD

Step 33:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (80 / 180) = Arc(AOC), ∠AOC = Arc(AOC)
Conclusions: pi * (80 / 180) = ∠AOC

Step 34:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠OAF = ∠OAG, ∠OAD = ∠OAF
Conclusions: ∠OAD = ∠OAG

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DOE = 2 * pi - ∠EOD, ∠DOE = ∠DOH
Conclusions: ∠DOH = 2 * pi - ∠EOD

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ODA = 2 * pi - ∠ADO, ∠ODA = ∠ODF
Conclusions: ∠ODF = 2 * pi - ∠ADO

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_O = AO, radius_O = CO
Conclusions: AO = CO

Step 38:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_O = AO, radius_O = DO
Conclusions: AO = DO

Step 39:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠FAO = ∠GAO, ∠DAO = ∠FAO
Conclusions: ∠DAO = ∠GAO

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBO, ∠CBO = ∠GBO
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = ∠CBO

Step 41:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * (80 / 180) = ∠DOB, ∠EOD = 2 * pi - ∠DOE, pi = ∠DOB + ∠EOD
Conclusions: 4.54 = ∠DOE

Step 42:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DOB = ∠DOF, pi * (80 / 180) = ∠DOB
Conclusions: pi * (80 / 180) = ∠DOF

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠ADO + ∠DOA + ∠OAD, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠ADO + ∠DOA + ∠OAD

Step 44:
Theorem: Issoceles Triangle Property
Premises : △ADO, AO = DO
Conclusions: ∠ADO = ∠OAD, ∠DAO = ∠ODA

Step 45:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠CBO
Conclusions: 0.44 = ∠CBO

Step 46:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (25 / 180) = ∠CBO, ∠CBO = 2 * pi - ∠OBC
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠OBC

Step 47:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 4.54 = ∠DOE, ∠DOE = ∠DOH
Conclusions: 4.54 = ∠DOH

Step 48:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DOB = ∠DOF, pi * (80 / 180) = ∠AOC, pi * (80 / 180) = ∠DOF
Conclusions: ∠AOC = ∠DOB

Step 49:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ADO = ∠OAD, ∠ADO = ∠FDO, ∠OAD = ∠OAG
Conclusions: ∠FDO = ∠OAG

Step 50:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ODA = ∠ODF, ∠DAO = ∠GAO, ∠DAO = ∠ODA
Conclusions: ∠GAO = ∠ODF

Step 51:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * (25 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠OBC
Conclusions: 5.85 = ∠OBC

Step 52:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 4.54 = ∠DOH, ∠DOH = 2 * pi - ∠EOD
Conclusions: 4.54 = 2 * pi - ∠EOD

Step 53:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠AOC = ∠DOB, 2 * pi = ∠BOC + ∠COD + ∠DOB, 2 * pi = ∠AOC + ∠COD + ∠DOA
Conclusions: ∠BOC = ∠DOA

Step 54:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ODA = ∠ODF, ∠GAO = ∠ODF
Conclusions: ∠GAO = ∠ODA

Step 55:
Theorem: Side-Angle-Side Congruent Theorem
Premises : ∠BOC = ∠DOA, AO = CO, BO = DO
Conclusions: △ADO ≅ △CBO

Step 56:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △ADO ≅ △CBO
Conclusions: ∠OBC = ∠ODA, ∠BOC = ∠DOA, ∠ADO = ∠CBO, BO = DO

Step 57:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠GAO = ∠ODA, ∠OBC = ∠ODA, 5.85 = ∠OBC
Conclusions: 5.85 = ∠GAO

Step 58:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 0.44 = ∠CBO, ∠ADO = ∠FDO, ∠ADO = ∠CBO
Conclusions: 0.44 = ∠FDO

Step 59:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠GAO = ∠ODF, 5.85 = ∠GAO
Conclusions: 5.85 = ∠ODF

Step 60:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠FDO = ∠OAG, 0.44 = ∠FDO
Conclusions: 0.44 = ∠OAG

Step 61:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ODF = 2 * pi - ∠ADO, 5.85 = ∠ODF
Conclusions: 5.85 = 2 * pi - ∠ADO

Step 62:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 0.44 = ∠OAG, ∠OAD = ∠OAG
Conclusions: 0.44 = ∠OAD

Step 63:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠AOE + ∠DOA + ∠EOD, 0.44 = ∠OAD, 5.85 = 2 * pi - ∠ADO, 3.14 = ∠ADO + ∠DOA + ∠OAD, ∠AOE = 2 * pi - ∠EOA, 4.54 = 2 * pi - ∠EOD
Conclusions: 4.01 = ∠EOA

Step 64:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EOA = Arc(EOA), 4.01 = ∠EOA
Conclusions: 4.01 = Arc(EOA)
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Arc(A, O, C)), MeasureOf(Arc(D, O, B)))
